Description: Typical range for pulsed Nd:YAG lasers (1064 nm) on porous stones like travertine to remove contaminants without thermal damage; starting at 50 W for light soiling, max 200 W risks microcracking (source: IPG Photonics laser cleaning guidelines and studies on limestone ablation, e.g., J. Cult. Herit. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Travertine absorption and minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for balanced cleaning efficiency and resolution
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and process speed
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal with controlled thermal penetration
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning without overlapping damage
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for complete coverage without excessive energy deposition
